question_sentence: Which of the following pollutes the air, according to a new study?
IKEA announced it is offering a candle that smells like the company’s:
Rihanna reached what milestone this week?
choices: She became the most-streamed musician of all time.
She became the youngest CEO of multiple Fortune 500 companies.
She was named the new president of Universal Music Group.

question_sentence: Which recent event did a health expert call a “recipe for disaster”?
choices: The Los Angeles premiere of “Jungle Cruise”

question_sentence: Simone Biles made a triumphant return for her last final at the Tokyo Olympics. Which event did she compete in?
Flight attendants restrained a Frontier Airlines passenger during a flight last week because he allegedly:
Bacon could disappear in which state when an animal welfare law takes effect next year?
What percentage of New Yorkers believe Gov. Andrew Cuomo should resign amid harassment allegations, per a Marist College poll?
Officials are closing some areas in Lake Tahoe after which animals tested positive for plague?
True or false: Microwaving a penny will shrink the coin, as claimed by a widely shared social media post.
choices: True. It’s due to thermal expansion.
False. The penny won’t shrink, but it could start a fire.

question_sentence: “If you’re unvaccinated, unfortunately, you will not be able to participate in many things.” Referencing upcoming vaccine mandates, which city’s mayor said these words?
evidence: These were the words of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, referencing the city’s upcoming vaccine requirements for restaurants, fitness centers and indoor entertainment venues. The move falls in line with an ever-growing list of private companies mandating vaccines.

question_sentence: Mexico is suing 11 entities for their part in the drug trade and other crime. What type of entities are implicated in the lawsuit?
evidence: Filed in a US Federal Court in Boston, the lawsuit names 11 gun manufacturers, including Smith & Wesson, Colt and Glock, over firearms that flow from the US into criminal hands in Mexico.

question_sentence: Which US state saw coronavirus-related hospitalizations increase to levels 13% above its previous peak in July 2020?
evidence: Florida, according to the Florida Hospital Association, has seen the dramatic increase in hospitalizations. The FHA predicts that 60% of hospitals are likely to face a “critical staffing shortage” in the coming days.

question_sentence: In which country was Ebrahim Raisi sworn in as president?
evidence: Following eight years of Hassan Rouhani’s moderate rule, Ebrahim Raisi was sworn in as Iran’s latest president, signifying a new age of hard-line politics that could result in major changes to the country’s policies – both domestic, and abroad.

question_sentence: What item from Princess Diana and Prince Charles’ 1981 wedding is going up for auction?
choices: a slice of the couple’s wedding cake
evidence: A slice of the couple’s wedding cake will go up for auction on August 11, an item expected to go for at least 200 pounds — or nearly $278.

question_sentence: Citing safety concerns and potential retribution from her government, Belarusian Olympic sprinter Kristina Timanovskaya refused to board a plane in Tokyo back to Belarus, seeking asylum. Which country ultimately granted the athlete a humanitarian visa?
evidence: Timanovskaya was granted a humanitarian visa by Poland, eventually landing in Warsaw following the incident.

question_sentence: According to a statement on its own website, which football club is Argentinian Soccer superstar Lionel Messi leaving?
evidence: According to the statement, Messi – one of the highest paid athletes in the history of sport — will be leaving Barcelona, a club he joined in 2004. It’s where he won 10 La Liga titles and four Champions Leagues.

question_sentence: How much debt did US households hold at the end of June?
evidence: Fueled by a surge in credit card spending and home purchases, US households held $14.96 trillion dollars in debt at the end of June – the largest amount of bills on record.

question_sentence: According to a recent Cox Automotive report, which type of automobile sold for 8% above sticker price last month?
evidence: Contrary to what’s typically considered popular, demand for minivans is on the rise. They’re selling at an average 8% above sticker price, all as families look for more practical options. In contrast, trucks, cars and SUVs have been selling at sticker price.

question_sentence: According to new research from the University of Bristol, which animals were found to be as socially complex as elephants?
evidence: Long misunderstood, the study found giraffes to be as socially complex as elephants, primates and even orcas. “It is baffling to me how such a charismatic and well-known species as the giraffe could have been so understudied until recently,” said Zoe Muller, biologist and study author.
